title: [BUG] Forms.WPF: Background of view isn't respected
body:
**Description**

If you set the background property for SKGLView or SKCanvasView in WPF, then it isn't respected. The GPU backed background is black, the CPU backed background is white. If you use `Canvas.Clear()`, then the color is set correct.

**Code**

See https://github.com/charlenni/SkiaTest for WPF. Toggle creation of background with checkbox at bottom.

**Expected Behavior**

Background color should be set by property Background.

**Actual Behavior**

Background color is only set by `Canvas.Clear(color)`.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.2-preview.60
- Last known good version:  Didn't checked before
- IDE:  VisualStudio 2019 16.5.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: Forms.WPF
- Windows Classic:  Windows 10

**Screenshots**

<!-- if the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

**Reproduction Link**

See [SkiaTest](https://github.com/charlenni/SkiaTest).
